module_restrictions: Students are allowed to take courses offered by other departments/institutes, in addition to those of their own departments/institutes. They can also take courses of different program years and levels. Undergraduate students may take graduate courses, and vice versa.
visa_info: Students whose exchange period is one semester (or less than 180 days) will have to apply for a Visitor Visa while students whose exchange period is more than 180 days will have to apply for a Resident Visa. Chinese, Hong Kong and Macau passport holders will need to apply for a Taiwan Entry Permit.
accommodations_info: On-campus accommodation is available to exchange students. After applications are accepted by NCKU, applicants will be prompted by email to sign up for on-campus accommodation online. Please note that space of the on-campus accommodation is not guaranteed, and students will be responsible for their own housing expenses. To have a quick review of NCKU on-campus dormitory designated to exchange students, please take a look at Ching-Yeh 3 Dorm, which offers double rooms to international students.
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses in Taiwan are as follows:

- Accommodation: NTD $3500 - NTD$9000
- Food and transport: NTD $8000
- Others (Entertainment, clothes, etc): NTD $10,000

The monthly estimate for living expenses ranges from NTD$21,500 to NTD$27,000.
